text: Porthmadog (; ) is a coastal town and community in Gwynedd, Wales. The 2011 census revealed that the town has a population of 4,185. Until 1974, it was also known by its anglicised name of Portmadoc and was known locally as Port. The town came into existence after William Madocks built a sea wall, the Cob, between 1808 and 1811. Category:Towns in Gwynedd
title: Porthmadog
